titleStmt.title: Publicanus vindicatus: or, A short narrative of the occasion and obstruction in thepayment [sic] of the late Kings debts contracted upon the customes; together, with his owne unhappy condition by reason thereof. Written for publick satisfaction, but more particularly for the creditors, to whom it is dedicated, this anno 1654. By Sir John Jacob, Knight.
titleStmt.author: Jacob, John, Sir, 1597 or 8-1666.
Jacob, John, 17th cent., attributed name.

titleStmt.title: Publicanus vindicatus: or, A short narrative of the occasion and obstruction in thepayment [sic] of the late Kings debts contracted upon the customes; together, with his owne unhappy condition by reason thereof. Written for publick satisfaction, but more particularly for the creditors, to whom it is dedicated, this anno 1654. By Sir John Jacob, Knight.
titleStmt.author: Jacob, John, Sir, 1597 or 8-1666.
Jacob, John, 17th cent., attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Wing's attribution to the John Jacob who wrote 'Even ler'sh pina the Jew turned Christian' is erroneous.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
